techmeme.title: Sources: Sequoia stands to gain about $2.65B in Klarna's IPO, a six-fold return on its total investment of ~$500M; it is selling ~2% of its stake in the IPO (Katie Roof/The Information)
Apple says the iPhone 17 lineup and iPhone Air come with Memory Integrity Enforcement, which provides "industry-first, always-on memory safety protection" (Richard Lawler/The Verge)
Apple Watch's hypertension notifications and sleep score will come to some older models with watchOS 26; FDA clearance for the notifications is expected soon (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Source: Klarna and some shareholders raised $1.37B in a US IPO that was more than 20x oversubscribed, selling 34.3M shares at $40 each, above the marketed range (Anthony Hughes/Bloomberg)
A profile of 6-year-old Ramp, which has grown to a $22.5B valuation as it expanded beyond corporate cards to tools for expense reporting, bill payment, and more (Leo Schwartz/Fortune)
